org.springframework.batch.item.database

Class IbatisBatchItemWriter<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.batch.item.database.IbatisBatchItemWriter<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ItemWriter<T>, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean
    Deprecated. 
    as of Spring Batch 3.0, in favor of the native Spring Batch support in the MyBatis follow-up project (http://mybatis.github.io/spring/)

    @Deprecated
public class IbatisBatchItemWriter<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ItemWriter<T>, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean
    ItemWriter that uses the batching features from SqlMapClient to execute a batch of statements for all items provided.
    The user must provide an iBATIS statement id that points to the SQL statement defined in the iBATIS SqlMap configuration.
    It is expected that write(List) is called inside a transaction.
    The writer is thread-safe after its properties are set (normal singleton behavior), so it can be used to write in multiple concurrent transactions.
    Note: This reader was refactored as part of Spring Batch 3.0 to use the iBatis APIs directly instead of using Spring's SqlMapClientTemplate as part of the upgrade to support Spring 4.
    Since:
    2.0
